conclusion: Points A and B have equal magnitude like charges; electric field at O is E; potential at O is not given, potential at infinity is 0.
Electric fields from A and B at O are equal in magnitude and direction; net electric field at O is E.
A charge of equal magnitude but opposite sign is placed at C.
Electric field from charge at C will cancel out net electric field from A and B; net electric field at O will be zero.
Potential at O is the sum of potentials due to each charge; initially symmetric.
Potential due to each charge is V; initial potential at O is 2V; adding opposite charge at C changes potential to V.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O is 0; electric potential at O is V.
